I either get delivery or eat at Robongi at least once a week.  It's extremely dependable and fast.  I highly recommend their special sushi rolls, which are unique and Robongi's fish is fresh.One tip about ordering from Robongi: I would avoid getting any hot foods delivered, e.g. beef teriyaki, because it generally comes cold.  This is not to say that they're slow, I think it's just hard to keep smaller quantities of food hot, when it's combined with a delivery of sushi.

This is one of the best sushi place in hoboken area. I absolutely love it. Food is very good and fresh. sometimes they give out edamame as compliementary appetizer.Summer time is the best, where you can get outside seatings. enjoy people watching and lovely meal.The staffs are very friendly, that's another reason I love this place.B.Y.O.B

Well first off, I'm from Brooklyn and am used to eating rolls for $2.50 or $3.  Actually I'm more into all you can eat sushi.  So I came here after a canoeing trip.  The place was crowded and the scenery was quite dark.  The music was pumping like it was a club.  Well I'm pretty sure people come here before they hit up the bars and clubs.  This place is definitely more expensive than the sushi joints in BK.  The bento box was 21 bucks and the rolls ranged from $3- alot more.  I had the chicken katsu.  I asked the waiter if I could get that in a bento box and he said no.  No special requests for the paying customer?? The chicken katsu was just your average bbq chicken.  The service was alright except the waiter didn't even know today's special.  He had to look back at his notepad and read it to us LOL.  I wouldn't come back to this place to eat but I would come back to Hoboken.  What a nice neighborhood to visit!

The best sushi you will find in the area (and believe me, I've had a lot of sushi in this area). Very fresh and well made. Service is attentive as well. My dad and I went here for dinner and went to town. The only con to this place is the atmosphere. During off times its great... But at night it takes on a night club appearance with BLASTING music. I couldn't hear the person next to me. And the space is a bit cramped so that is no small feat. When my Dad comes to town it is the first place we look to go.... unless its during peek hours.

This place is like the Applebee's of Sushi. I've never been to a Sushi tackier restaurant besides a Sushi/diner establishment in out in the middle of Pennsylvania. The place is always crowded and its usually difficult to get a table, especially on a weekend night. A lot of people have recommended this place and I really don't know why. Even after making myself focus on the food instead of all the stupid garbage hung on the walls I can't say that the food was particularly memorable. I would describe it as average quality sushi. Combine that with the awful atmosphere of the place and I would say that there's much better options for sushi in Hoboken. The service was also pretty lousy, there were 3 of us and they brought out the food for 2 people (even though we all placed fairly similar orders) way before the 3rd person got their food leading to an uncomfortable "go ahead, start eating" negotiation.

It was totally a disaster!!! I ordered a food delivery today, and it took over 3hrs to arrive. Notice that, the restaurant is in Hoboken and I'm in Jersey City, only 2mi away. And it took 3 HOURS! Finally I cancel the delivery cuz it's toooooo slow. And then the delivery driver became mad at me. He yelled at me with some really bad words. I am a customer who has been waiting 3hrs for food, and he is the guy to get mad?! That's too hilarious and it's way beyond my tolerance. I have to rate it one star. And I would rate it minus 100 stars if Yelp has that option!!!

Loved it! It was my first time in Hoboken and I was surprised to see that most if not all of the restaurants on Washington St. are BYOB.... but hey, no complaints, it saves $$$. So Meggy & I decided on Robongi for our sushi lunch due to its outdoor seating and proximity to the liquor store :) Everything was fantastic, the waiters were super friendly without being annoying, they opened our beers for us every time we grabbed another from the bucket of ice water they brought us to keep it cold in...(are you kidding??).... the sushi was great, I tried a roll I have never had, spinach shitake. The prices were a tad higher than I'm used to, but barely and well worth it because of the overall relaxed easy breezy time we had. We will definitely return.

If you're craving authentic Japanese cuisine in all of its greasy goodness (well, sometimes anyway), then Robongi is NOT the place you're look for. However, if you're looking for standard, but decently prepared, Japanese dishes to compliment an awesome night of bar hopping and such, or a good date place, then this is it.I was unfortunate enough to visit Robongi a little before they closed. However, even then, the service was pretty nice and comforting. The interior of the restaurant is quite decorative with the typical Japanese fixtures seen at these kinds of places. The food was pretty well-made, though it's not mind-blowing. Prices were mostly in-line with what you'd expect from a Hoboken restaurant.RECOMMENDATION: This is a great place to check out, but not if you're looking for the real deal.

May I first say: cheap sushi.  AND it was good.So this place is unconventional for sure.  It's decorated more like a Floridian lobster shop, but I suppose I can appreciate the not-so-expected atmosphere.  Long and narrow, the space holds a decent amount of tables.  Sashimi is very good here, lunch box specials are super cheap with tons of food, and there are a lot of options on the menu.  And, because I'm not cool, the wait staff explained to me which fish on my plate was which.  Thanks, dude.

I eat tons of sushi and this place is very solid. The specials are defn choice. They usually give you a decent dessert on the house too. Which is nice! Kid friendly too.the service is good. sometimes a bit overzealous as the wine (byob!) was uncorked before we even took our jackets off.

Hands down the best sushi in Hoboken. Always, always, always freshest quality fish. The staff are friendly and competent and the restaurant itself is very clean. It's BYOB, which is nice, and the prices are reasonable. I recommend this place over any of the zillion other sushi joints in Hoboken.
There's variety at this place. I loved the spicy tuna salad. I had a few other rolls and the shrimp tempura.  It was a typical sushi place for me. It was a little pricey.
Best sushi in Hoboken. And the banana tempura was incredible. Try the eel Lovet! Eel rolls are the best IMO

Not only is the food here excellent, but the staff is amazing. I have a friend who comes here all the time, and we get treated like royalty every time we go, including being treated to special and sample dishes. I don't eat non-veggie sushi, so I can't talk honestly about the seafood (which is a shame, because that's really their forte, i think...) But I can say that their gyoza and tempura are really good.I agree that it is a small place, and can get crowded, so it might be best to call ahead. (And don't forget, it's BYOB!)

The salmon skin appetizer was very good. It was crispy, had skin stripes with a lot of meat on them, and the portion was big. The staff was 100% great. They even went so far as to charge our low battery mobile. When they found out one of us had a food allergy they double checked all of the orders. I would totally go back. Tasty fresh and wonderful service.

fast and friendly service. HUGE 90s dance party! i'm a novice sushi eater, at best, but the app (veggie dumplings) and 3 rolls (spicy tuna, spicy california, spider) that we got were very delicious and affordable, the perfect amount of food for two people. i even managed to hold on to my chopsticks the entire time! It's BYOB, which is a huge plus too! there are plenty of other sushi places around town but because of the fun atmosphere and attentive service, i will probably be back.

Loud fun atmosphere for a party inside. Outdoor seating is great for warmer weather. Byob is always appreciated and the servers really pay attention to your alcohol. Waiters are friendly and attentive.  Sushi is fresh, and a great value. This is My fave sushi place in Hoboken!  Whenever my family comes to visit, we'd dine here for our sushi fix. Indoor is fun, but too loud to really talk to a person 1 seat away from you. Expect people to dance in their dining seats while drinking their wine and eating edamame.

They have good sushi and their service is on point. They need a bigger selection though and the pirate decor kind of throws me off. Not the type of place you bring a nice date to but you can't beat the prices.

My favorite sushi place in Hoboken.  They're great for take-out/delivery or eat in.  It can get a little loud on the weekends, but the service is always excellent.  It's a BYOB, so bring your own saki and get ready for a good time.  Just a side note, my favorite saki is a cold saki and it's called "Pearl."  Most liquor stores carry it and it's around $14/bottle.  Anyway, back to the food...Robongi has very fresh fish that's always delicious.  Highly recommended and one of my staple delivery places.
Best sushi I've had so far.  No matter if I order it for delivery or dine in the restaurant it has exceeded every other sushi place I have gone to in Hoboken by a large amount.
It's on my block so I go a lot. Great place to have a fun dinner. Sushi is good and sometimes great!  BYOB makes it a special treat.

Please understand when the yelp filter attacks this realize that this has nothing to do with the food. The food is good. I ordered from delivery.com. Ten minutes after I ordered I received a call from them saying, "hey you want spicy mayo sauce, that will be $2.15" i said "okay" and got the money out. When the guy came and i gave him the money and went inside to find that they did not give me the spicy mayo sauce. Needless to say I was upset because if you had the nerve to call me and tell me I owed more money at least get the order right. I called them to ask where it was and they said, "oh um sorry driver will bring it out to you" I said, " how long?" She says 30mins. So you want me to wait 30 more mins to eat my food. Thats unacceptable I said, " no, I am going to call delivery.com and they will talk to you. They called and managers didnt really care at all that they treated a customer like this and they said the spicy mayo sauce will be there in 30. I said tell them i do not want it and I want that money back. After a back and forth they are giving me the money back and its not about the money its awful customer service.

We ordered from Robongi and our order arrived 1 hour and 45 minutes after the order was originally placed. We have ordered a few times from Robongi and to be honest the quality of their food has dropped since they came on the scene  and were winning rave reviews back in 2007. After going to some amazing sushi joints in NY and LA,  their food is just bla. Wont be going back. It's the third late shitty order and this one was the absolute last. Not happy!

What a fun place for sushi! The first time I went there I was shocked at the loud hiphop music, but after a while it grows on you :) Service is great and attentive, though there are a few lingering waiters that are a little too pushy, always trying to clear the table before you've finished eating. I love their assortment of specialty rolls, especially the changing weekly specials. They like to match their weekly specials to holidays or seasons. I always try them out. Sometimes I stop in after work for some take out and they are great about offering me a seat and water while I wait. I would give them 5 stars if they had better appetizers and a classier ambience. Bumpin music is great for a party but not my preference for dinner, especialy after a long day of work. So I don't recommend this place fro a romantic date, but definitely for a laid back meal without breaing the bank. Order Tips:- Definitely try the Rock & Roll. Yoro roll is good too. And always try something new on their weekly specials!

OVERPRICED and terrible customer service! i accidentally ordered 3 orders of something and when i called immediately to make the change - they refused! sucks for them. i order sushi ALOT and will not be ordering again.

So friendly! :o) The Sushi regular combo was AWESOME. Tons of great sushi for a great price. Best of all, the people that took us are regulars, so the wait staff brought us a free desert -- Mango sorbet in a mango shell, with a scoop of lychee sorbet and two cigar cookies. Yum!A great evening or date location!

The outdoor dining and crowded tables attracted me to this hot spot. Indoor and outdoor seating available. Although it's busy, the space is comfortable. Good for duo meals or groups. Extensive menu of delicious Japanese cuisine. Affordable. The Nasu, baked eggplant w/ miso sauce appetizer, was amazing. Subtle yet tasty.
   However, I was not a fan of the Chicken roll appetizer. We also ordered 1 spicy tuna hand roll and the shrimp tempura roll. I did not try the shrimp tempura but I was told it was good. The spicy tuna wasn't very spicy... a little disappointing. Overall, this place was a fun atmosphere and had good sushi. I would return again.
delivery took over an hour when it was expected to take 25 - 40 minutes. driver was also very rude. not ordering from here again

The restaurant is at a really good location, byob, friendly wait staff, etc.  BUT the only reason i'm only giving it a 1 star is because the rice they used is NOT sweet rice.  I know sweet rice is much more expensive but why.... why serve jasmine rice?  i'm asian, i grow up eating rice almost everyday of my life.  I know this grain/texture.  It was dry and undercooked.  I'm sorry, you can't open a sushi place and serve BAD rice.

Love this place!!!  The food was excellent and the wait staff was quite friendly.  We got there around 9ish and left at closing time which was 11:30.  Local laws prevented us from sitting outside after 11 so the staff moved us inside and told us we could leave whenever.  Pretty sweet.  We ordered the seaweed salad as an appetizer and capped the night with another seaweed salad.  For our main meal, we got 3 different hand rolls (Sakura, Spicy California, and Crazy Horse) plus the sashimi platter.  The Sakura roll was especially delicious and highly recommended.  The place is also BYOB with no bottle charge.  Awesome!!!  We picked up 4 bottles of sake from a small market a block away.  I think 4 girls finished off 4 bottles of sake in 3 hours...no worries...sake doesn't cause bad hangovers the next day.  I'm living proof...teehee.  The place gets quite busy during dinner, but the wait is not too bad.  I highly recommend this place if you're in the Hoboken area and craving yummy japanese.  Kampai!!!

Simply the best sushi in Hoboken.  The prices are slightly higher than at other Japanese restaurants in the city, but the quality of the fish is significantly better, and they consistently produce superb product.  No matter what I order, I always include a spicy scallop roll.  Not into the odd ship/fishing motif?  Delivery is always prompt and accurate.

The fish here is excellent, and they have rolls that can be made without rice, wrapped in cucumber.  This was especially surprising to find in New Jersey.I have been told that it's the best sushi/sashimi in Hoboken... so I've never tried any of the other sushi bars.  After eating at Robongi once, though, and loving it, I don't see why I should bother trying any of the others... I mean, once you've found good sashimi, why go someplace else?

The food is ok. I went to the place because of the 4 star rating, but I was so disappointed. The decoration is kinda interesting and cute. I ordered sashimi, but they were too thin, and not that fresh. Overall, the place is not worth four stars.

Great sushi and if the weather is nice they have outdoor seating. Good service, food comes out fast... All in all for a lower end sushi place I'll go there again.  Outdoor chairs super noisy and annoying... Nothing to do with the food or service I know, but something I noticed. Every time someone got up or sat down it was a loud metal scrapping sound. Pretty annoying through your whole dinner.

Sushi was average although the menu was very extensive and interesting. I just don't think the service was so great. They were very nice to the regulars but not to me and my daughter. Maybe I wasn't young enough for them. I don't know. I didn't get the complimentary edamame and we got gross plastic side plates. It was just okay.

MMMMM!!!!  this is my favorite place for sushi.  not only is the fish always fresh and rolls super yummy, the staff is always so nice (last time they gave me a free order of edamame while i waited for the rest of my party to get there)!  try the I-Make roll (it's got soft-shell crab in it) or the Sakura roll when you go.  there's a deli that sells wine/sake/beer a few stores down which is convenient for this BYOB.  yes, the techno music can get loud but it's a small price to pay for great food and great service.

The sushi here is phenomenal and the options pretty much endless.  My wife enjoyed her rock shrimp as well.  The loud techno beat gets a little much but the place has a cool vibe to it.  To avoid having to talk over the music, sitting outside is always an option.  I like the BYOB rules of lots of restaurants in Hoboken.  Saves a bunch on the drink bill and you get exactly what you want.  It helps that there are liquor stores along Washington street interspersed among the myriad dining spots!  The decor is really funky cool and the service is outstanding.  We've been here on successive visits to the area and will definitely return in the future!

My favorite Japanese restaurant ever! Their service is always excellent regardless of how busy they are. Their food is fresh and always really good. Sushi, rolls and teriyaki are all very good. Every restaurant in Hoboken should learn from Robongi - they remember their customers and always greet you with warm welcomes. It makes you feel like the restaurant is truly a part of the Hoboken neighborhood.
Great service: wait staff was great and very attentive. Even when we ordered the wrong item, they fixed it without any hassle.

DISCO SUSHI!!!!!!!!This place is LOUD.  And that can either be a good thing, or a bad thing.  This is NOT the place for a first date - you'll end up spending the whole night saying "WHAT? ".  This is a great place for a group of friends to get together / pre-game / whatever.   First off, its BYO, and they make no qualms about it.  Expect to see lots of ex-frat / sorority folks drinking HARD (and screaming over the music).  The décor (kitchy, crab shack-esque) just seems to lend itself to that sort of behavior (and it's not a bad thing if you're in the mood for that).The food: spot on.  Great sushi. Large rolls (never seem to be a problem), fresh fish, plentiful appetizers.  I would say second best sushi in Hoboken (give the slight edge to Sushi House - Uptown). So, in summary, depending on your mood, this is the great place, or a way too loud frat party.  Either way, the sushi is legit.

I love this place! I work about a block away so I come here pretty often. The Iso roll is definitely my favorite. Everything else I've tried was delicious too. The staff is always very nice and pleasant.

Best sushi in Hoboken.  Fast, friendly staff, and fun atmosphere inside.  Once they know your face, they will often throw in a complimentary edamame, seaweed salad, or dessert.  They know how to take care of their regulars.  They will even put your wine in an ice bucket while you wait for a table.  Food is very fresh and well prepared.
Nothing impressive and I would say below average sushi quality and portions.  I ordered tuna, salmon and octopus sushi.

This place is fantastic. I have has sushi around the world and feel that for US sushi this place deserves a high score. the food is fresh, the service prompt the place is clean. I really enjoyed everything that my party order. i fully recommend this place. It is also very reasonable priced.
The rice layer around their rolls are so thick and the rolls were messy as if made by a newbie. I wasn't impressed and will not order again.

I stopped by here for takeout and had the soft shell crab tempura and spicy tune tartare. I really love soft shell crab in general and thought the tempura was good and the portion size larger than I expected also. I also thought the spicy tuna tartare was pretty good. There was a distinct spicy flavor, which sometimes is missing from "spicy" tuna tartare. I definitely plan on returning to try other menu items.

Food good. Place way too small for the volume they try to serve and the music and service would be appropriate for the Jersey Shore... It's bring your own bottle. Perfect place for a sixteen year old's birthday.

Excellent sushi and a fair price.  Love the bento box for lunch.   For dinner we get edamame, miso soup and a bunch of rolls to share.  Never have to wait too long for a table and the service is great. The food comes so fast!  Nice lively atmosphere, love their music.
Mediocre sushi. Lunch special is 2 rolls and soup or salad, not 3 like most places. Service was very attentive. Most plates/glasses had big chips out of them.

I like their sushi and I'll be back. As noted in other reviews, the service can range from good to exceptional. (On St. Patrick's Day, for instance, they served me sake, gratis, notwithstanding they don't have a liquor license.)

BYOB is the best. The food was good, but expensive. That waiters are super nice. We brought in beers and sake--they heated our sake and kept our beers on ice and would come around and pour us more when we ran out. They also are down to do sake bombs!

Been here at least four times in the last three months, and its been very good each time.  Once was for a birthday and we had a party of 16 that was accommodated as well as it could have been.  The fish is good, and the servers fast and well trained.  I think the manager is named Ivan and he does a very good job making people welcome as well as turning the tables.  The BYOB factor is great and helps out a bunch with the check.  Is it the best or most fashionable sushi place around?  Probably not, but its fun and well run, and obviously liked by many regulars which is evident any weekend night.

First off ask for a seat away from the bathroom, the constant shuffling of patrons behind your seat is enough to throw off any good meal. Once you do that though you are in for a treat. Great sushi at reasonable prices and it's a byob!
Excellent service and really great sushi. The staff is very friendly and even though it's B.Y.O. you can find yourself enjoying some complementary sake. One of my favorite spots in Hoboken.
Great sushi.One of my favorites in Hoboken. The service is great as well
Incredible delivery experience, on a Monday. Salmon combo lunch special was out of this world. Best California roll. Yellowtail collar, as always, just delicious.

I think there in the top 3 sushi restaurants in Hoboken. The food is always fresh and consistent. The staff is friendly and service is excellent. I like the atmosphere when dining in at night time. Makes for a good date place as well.

Good, fresh sushi, and well-priced to boot.  Being BYO helps too.  The decor is, well, untraditional, for a sushi joint.  It's full of "crabby" decor and funny signs.  Doesn't exactly scream "Japanese restaurant."  Then again, who cares?  The one down side is that they pump really loud techno/dance/bad pop that makes it difficult to carry on a conversation.  All in all, good sushi, but not ideal of a date... unless you don't want to talk to them anyhow.

I WOULD NEVER GO BACK HERE!Went back this past Saturday for dinner with my friend. We got there got there around 8 and had no reservation. It was packed and the hostess (I think?) told us to come back at 8:20. We went to another bar where my friend chugged a glass of wine and I left mine unfinished (because I am not that gansta) to get back in time. When we got back it was even more crowded, like no room to even step inside the restaurant. We waited until 8:45 while some other guy sat everyone else except us. A couple even walked in and was sat right away while the new host winked at them. My friend was getting really angry and started arguing with the original hostess who told us she had nothing to do with seating. I knew it was time to leave when my friend got loud because I didn't want spit in my sushi. We went next door to Wild Ginger where we were sat right away. I guess Robangi does not want new customers!

Decent sushi - nothing all that memorable but not bad either.  The edamame was typical (but not much you can do to improve edamame).  I had the yellowtail scallion rolls and the Crazy Horse rolls.  They both had very fresh fish but the texture of the rolls was a bit mushy.  Bonus points for being BYOB and having outdoor seating.  Good service.

I was really hoping to love this place. Maybe I hyped it up in my head. I don't quite get the "theme" (pictures don't lie) to Robongi. Walking up to the front door, the first thing I noticed was the sign that says, "hot fat crabs"... I don't know about the rest of you, but that doesn't scream appetizing to me. But the reviews are pretty good for this place, so I was willing to forget about it and just eat. We ordered fried rock shrimp as an appetizer, which was very good. Sadly, the entrees were simply lacking. Unfortunately, the rice with the sushi deluxe was not sticky enough and crumbled upon contact. This should not happen with sushi. Our other entree was an eel cucumber wrapped special chef roll. It was slightly warmer than room temperature, inconsistently wrapped and oddly sized. If that doesn't sound too good to you then I described it well. Hoboken is a tiny, parking lot of a city, but it has a plethora of dining gems. This isn't one of them. At least, not that afternoon.

This place is so overrated. I was here about 4 years ago and remember it being pretty decent but then again at that time I think I only had a quick sushi roll. Came back over this past weekend and was pretty surprised to see that this had 4 stars  . I ordered sashimi deluxe which I have to say the cuts were generous but the quality was just ok. What bothered me the most was our waiter messed up my order. 1st he forgot that I didn't want red tuna so my sashimi platter came with it and I just let it go. 2nd he forgot about a special roll that I had also ordered. This place is just ok, nothing great and I probably will never come back. Coming from living in Cali for some years i think i got a taste of true sushi and From what I heard the owners are Chinese not Japanese....nevertheless I your looking to eat sushi in Hoboken I would probably go to Maru Sushi or Sushi Lounge

My go-to sushi place in Hoboken. It's BYO and they have a great selection of rolls. My favorites are the Yab's and Black and Yellowtail. The service is also great. On the weekends they get pretty busy so expect a wait, but it's worth it in the end.

The best sushi around. Period. However, if you care to talk to your dining companions, I would HIGHLY suggest avoiding this restaurant after 8pm on Friday or Saturday night. This is when they crowd tables where there were none, and play fist-pumping techno so loud you cannot hear yourself barely chew raw fish. The prices are beyond reasonable. You cannot find fresh, delicious, large amounts of sushi this good for this price anywhere. Their delivery is fast as well.

I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the sushi and the rolls. It's run by Chinese folks and in Hoboken, so I wasn't expecting much. I ordered by phone and the woman taking my order had a pretty thick accent and trouble understanding what I wanted. The music (club-like) was so loud, it's probably not all her fault. Don't order from here (or most other sushi places) on a Monday or Tuesday. That's my advice.
Service was great but the sushi didn't taste very fresh. Tuna and avocado was decent, but the california roll was gross. I would give it another shot but overall wasn't very impressed

Best sushi in Hoboken.  Not a fancy place, good service and a fun atmosphere makes this place worth the wait.  Bring your own beer and wine cuts your bill in half (if you drink).  The sushi chefs are very good and are willing to make orders off the menu.  Great place I go there once a week.

I was only going to give this place 3 stars because of the fact that the food was average, but the service went above and beyond.  I came here with my in-laws on Christmas Eve.  Not only were they one of the few places that was open that night, but they also were so helpful with all our crazy questions, and requests.  My sister-in-law doesn't really like fish, so she requested some vegetarian rolls that weren't on the menu and they accommodated us, no sweat.  They gave us great suggestions, and were very friendly.  I would go back there again just because I love places that value customer service.  The food came out fast, but we weren't pushed out the door or anything.  And tho the food was good -- I wouldn't call it great or fantastic or anything -- pretty good sushi.

Ordered take-out from here for a pajama/TV night with 2 girlfriends, and they delivered very quickly. Place is a bit pricey. Solid beef donburi and dragon sushi roll. Really amazing American Dream sushi roll. Wish I could have tried my friend's udon because it looked satisfying.

Robongi is definitely packed - it is crowded, it is loud, it is BYOB....hmm, maybe this could work after all.I would definitely reccomend it for big groups out on the town, maybe not TOO big of groups b/c of the noise, but 4-8 people should be able to haev a raucous conversation over some beer or wine.Wouldn't want to go on a date here when its crowded, it would be too hard to have that witty banter...although the awkward silences might be easier to withstand.I don't like sushi so I have the rice bowl with pork and egg sauce...it is amazing.
Japanese restaurant with a bit of pirate-ship vibe. The food was okay -- not ultra-great, but pretty good. For the quality, thought it was a bit overpriced, but again, not too bad.

Fantastic sushi, fresh sashimi, awesome grilled yellowtail collar, super friendly service, smiling servers, free dessert, and free-flowing water into your glass without asking plus a byo... What more could you ask for?! 5 stars, hands down, and tell Ivan I said hi!

I just have to add an update here as it never fails to impress. Came here today for lunch and ordered my normal sushi lunch for one. Sushi made to perfection. Quick and friendly service. Find me a better sushi place in Hoboken. I dare you :)

The decor may seem a little confusing at first (am I at Joe's Crab Shack or a sushi restaurant?). However, the sushi and sashimi is fresh and better than most restaurants in Hoboken. Plus its BYOB... no complaints there!
Has gone substantially down hill.  Used to be the best sushi in town (in a town of mediocre sushi) and is now one of worst.  Sushi was not fresh at all.  Rice was hard.  No more Robongi for me.

This is a one of best casual Japanese food in Hoboken.  The staff are very enthusiastic as in Japan.  Outdoor sitting is as relax as you can be.  The food is amazing.  Sushi is always fresh, Chef's rolls are full with surprise.  The best of all is the Yaki Udo.  You got to try their Yaki Unod.
I go here for lunch quite often and always have a pleasant experience.  The fish is fresh and the service is extremely friendly.   The price for the lunch combo is great too.  Highly recommended!

This sushi was spectacularly average, and the decor is all fish nets and nautical crap. Even Red Lobster's interior designer was like, that's tacky. Plus, I heard two Mandy Moore songs and one Jessica Simpson song within an hour. That's not good. The sole redemption was the wasabi shumai, which obliterated my mouth with white-hot deliciousness and had me begging for more.
this place was packed on a tues night! they have ok-tasting sushi but fresh & the pieces are huge. food is reasonably priced. atmosphere is casual and fun. great service.

I've never been to the Hoboken location, but I get delivery from the Weehawken location at least twice a week. I LOVE this place! They have amazing specialty rolls (the american dream and the sakura roll are my favorites as well as the sweet potato roll). Everything always tastes so fresh. Super fast delivery, I literally never wait longer than 20 minutes from the minute I place the phonecall. Highly recommended!!
I always have great experiences here. I love the Unagi don. It's not that crowded when I go there. It's not expensive either!

I just had lunch in Robongi this afternoon and I must say that it failed in a few places. I had the 2 roll lunch special and granted they had very fast service (served almost instantly) that could also be the downfall of my experience. I had the crispy salmon and crispy tuna and both "crispiness" of them felt stale. Granted, its a weekday and there aren't much people coming in, that shouldn't keep them from serving good food. It's averagely priced, though. Might come back but then there's about a hundred sushi places in Hoboken (someone would need to explain this to me). So maybe not anytime soon.

i love robongi and have eaten here numerous times over the past 5 years  for dinner.  they always have really good special rolls, and the wait staff always lets us know which one is the best (they usually have 2).  the fish is always fresh, and i have always been satisfied with my food.  and its a byob, added bonus!

I think that this place is great. It was my first sushi experience (about 3.5 years ago). I enjoy Robongi the most during the warmer months because of its outdoor seating on Washington. Everyone I've been with has also enjoyed their meals and the fact that it is BYOB since sushi is already an expensive meal (helps you save some money).

I wanted to find a sushi place to eat in hoboken and saw this place got some pretty good reviews on yelp.  It was byob and we picked up some beers at the liquor store a few blocks away.  We got there around 6:30.  The place is small and wasn't packed but it looks like there were party reservations cos they ended up seating us in the front near the door.  The decor is very nosy/dark with lots of fish nets, streamers, signs, etc which is different and I think they were trying to go for like a marina/street vendor look.  We got the gyoza and robongi crab cake which we thought was good.  Then we ordered the seafood comb teriyaki, rainbow and lobster roll.  I was expecting good sushi rolls but was pretty disappointed just the way they were presented.  The rolls were chef specials but they were 6 small pieces and rolled as if they squeezed too hard making the rice compacted with very minimum ingredients in them.  Maybe it was just that one sushi chef because I saw other people's meal and they look much better.  As we were eating, they were squeezing people in...ie. a couple, baby, stroller and highchair next to us in the small space in front of the window which was pretty annoying cos they were having a hard time situating themselves but it was a Friday night.
Food is expensive but they have great food. All of the fish taste fresh. I recommend the sushi deluxe. I'm not a fan of their kitchen food but anything from the sushi bar is great.

Robongi, without a doubt, has the best Japanese food of anywhere in Hoboken, or New Jersey, for that matter. The lunch special is reasonably priced and a delicious treat all year round. The sushi is fresh and the aesthetics of the dishes add to the always great flavor. Delivery is quick and the service is friendly. Robongi is must-have for all!

Fantastic sushi at a fantasic price...only down side is the bad selection of pop house music blasting in the place. Service was always great and if they know you will always knock back a Saki bomb with you. Saki Saki Saki BOMB!

eh is all I can say.  People need to venture in the city if they want real sushi.  My wife got lost and had to use restroom and she went to basement on accident and she saw 10 beds down there.  I guess they live here too?  It's just Sushi, nothing more.  Our waiter was very touchy feely, we didn't like that.

They get a 3.5 for food and a 5 for service. Apps  of wasabi sumai , full taste and just the right amount of wasabi, and edamani  overly top salted but fine once things were tossed to better mix the beans.  Sushi was fresh and fish was creamy in a good way.  Rice was slightly undercooked but only a partial detraction.  Chicken teriaki also flavorful and not over cooked.  For a causal place service was excellent. all requests , for ice; lemon slices etc, were quickly and professionally handled.  Our take home was thoughtfully packed with packets of soy without having to request it.  Addt to this eating outdoors on a pleasant day, cant be beat.

love this little hole in the wall. friday and sat nights its fun loud great crowd. food is fresh and best sushi in hoboken (or at least that i've found). Only downfall of this place is the wait staff...they rush rush rush youuuuuuuuu!!!! always looking for quick turnovers on the tables. I was able to pay by credit card here too maybe they have a minimum or something. its BYOB...i've seen people there with 30 packs...wine bottle(s) etc so bring it!

This is my favorite sushi restaurant-- hands down. Between sushi on Manhattan to Boston, to virtually anywhere I've sampled it, Robongi is the best. The crunchy spicy scallop roll is my favorite and the specials are always delectable. The atmosphere is one of a kind because the servers get to hook up their iPods and play what they want. I've heard everything from KC & JoJo, to the Spice Girls, to Tupac playing on any random night. The service is consistently the best I've ever had. Take a sip of your water and it's almost instantly refilled. It's BYOB, and the lunch specials are incredibly reasonable. I've dined al fresco, done take out, and received delivery, and I'm always impressed. Since moving away, anytime I find myself in the Hoboken/NYC area, I make sure to stop in for my favorite. Miss it so! =)
